content.html: If you want you can also check out my astrotomic.info packages. Most are pretty simple 1-2 class packages - so you should be able to get quickly through the package boilerplate and the real package logic.
content.text:
If you want you can also check out my astrotomic.info packages.
Most are pretty simple 1-2 class packages - so you should be able to get quickly through the package boilerplate and the real package logic.

content.html: Blogs aren't just for learning and teaching. Tom wrote a very personal post about loosing their french bulldog Yoda. It's good to write about emotions, it's good to vulnerable. Thank you for the courage of writing about this @devgummibeer gummibeer.dev/blog/2021/yoda/
content.text:
Blogs aren't just for learning and teaching. Tom wrote a very personal post about loosing their french bulldog Yoda. It's good to write about emotions, it's good to vulnerable. Thank you for the courage of writing about this @devgummibeer 

gummibeer.dev/blog/2021/yoda/

content.html: Coming back home with an empty leash is so hard. Condolences.
content.text: Coming back home with an empty leash is so hard. Condolences.

content.html: Yes, we already had a bad feeling when we left him back. But also a lot of hope and pray. 🙏
content.text: Yes, we already had a bad feeling when we left him back. But also a lot of hope and pray. 🙏

content.html: We haven't touched his leash until now … 😭
content.text: We haven't touched his leash until now … 😭

content.html: So sorry for your loss, Tom. Leaving Yoda over night at the vet must have been a gut-wrenching feeling. And then loosing him so fast … urgh. Stay strong! ♥️
content.text:
So sorry for your loss, Tom. Leaving Yoda over night at the vet must have been a gut-wrenching feeling. And then loosing him so fast … urgh.
Stay strong! ♥️

content.html: I've updated the post with Yodas "Criminal detective" 🕵️‍♂️ stories. 👮‍♂️🧑‍🚒 The streets were safer with Yoda on patrol. 😅
content.text:
I've updated the post with Yodas "Criminal detective" 🕵️‍♂️ stories. 👮‍♂️🧑‍🚒
The streets were safer with Yoda on patrol. 😅

content.html: Yes, independent of age - you are never prepared. Possibly it gets somehow easier if he arrives his "natural end of life". But I think not really. And the bad is that we tend to think that we have enough time and postpone so much.
content.text:
Yes, independent of age - you are never prepared.
Possibly it gets somehow easier if he arrives his "natural end of life". But I think not really.
And the bad is that we tend to think that we have enough time and postpone so much.

content.html: Use every minute, try to find a pet photographer and create some valuable memories!
content.text: Use every minute, try to find a pet photographer and create some valuable memories!

content.html: So I just hope that the last memories of him would turn into something positive in the long run... Keep strong and remember - if he saw you before the end, it still was the best day for him!
content.text: So I just hope that the last memories of him would turn into something positive in the long run... Keep strong and remember - if he saw you before the end, it still was the best day for him!

content.html: This took us by surprise and we all were scared to lose him... We know that he's old (11 years) and they usually live to 13 or so, but we were not ready for it... And reading your post I honestly felt what you feel... It's a loss of a friend, a partner for you...
content.text: This took us by surprise and we all were scared to lose him... We know that he's old (11 years) and they usually live to 13 or so, but we were not ready for it... And reading your post I honestly felt what you feel... It's a loss of a friend, a partner for you...

content.html: I know how that feels... Your words did touch me and made me realize that I too don't have a lot of pics of my dog that's still at parents... Worst part is that we almost lost him before Christmas. He had multiple tumors, testicles removed and really bad kidneys now...
content.text: I know how that feels... Your words did touch me and made me realize that I too don't have a lot of pics of my dog that's still at parents... Worst part is that we almost lost him before Christmas. He had multiple tumors, testicles removed and really bad kidneys now...

content.html: Not liver, kidney! I can't even get the right words out. Your blog post is so right. Make memories, take pictures, even the silly ones. Once again, I'm so sorry for your loss!
content.text:
Not liver, kidney! I can't even get the right words out.
Your blog post is so right. Make memories, take pictures, even the silly ones. 
Once again, I'm so sorry for your loss!

content.html: Thanks for sharing your story Tom!
content.text: Thanks for sharing your story Tom!

content.html: True. It's impossible to imagine the loss if you haven't experienced the same - which I don't wish anyone.
content.text: True. It's impossible to imagine the loss if you haven't experienced the same - which I don't wish anyone.

content.html: Oh no, I'm somehow super happy that Yoda "wait" after my birthday. I think I wouldn't be able to enjoy Christmas/birthday if he would have died right before. I wish you the best and stay strong!
content.text:
Oh no, I'm somehow super happy that Yoda "wait" after my birthday. I think I wouldn't be able to enjoy Christmas/birthday if he would have died right before.
I wish you the best and stay strong!

content.html: Thanks for the kind words.
content.text: Thanks for the kind words.

content.html: Yes! We are also very thankful that had these last moments together. Even if it was somehow selfish to wake him up again. But he also pulled all his energy together to make it happen. 😍
content.text:
Yes! We are also very thankful that had these last moments together. Even if it was somehow selfish to wake him up again.
But he also pulled all his energy together to make it happen. 😍

content.html: Thanks. It was similar for me why it took me so long to write this post and it's still not really complete. It's hard to sort thoughts but also to find the right words and even harder to translate them into English without losing meaning.
content.text:
Thanks. It was similar for me why it took me so long to write this post and it's still not really complete.
It's hard to sort thoughts but also to find the right words and even harder to translate them into English without losing meaning.

content.html: Absolutely in tears reading that. So sorry for your loss and thank you for sharing ❤
content.text: Absolutely in tears reading that. So sorry for your loss and thank you for sharing ❤

content.html: Ugh, I’m so sorry to hear that dude.
content.text: Ugh, I’m so sorry to hear that dude.

content.html: So sorry, Tom. I am glad you had the opportunity to say goodbye though, it doesn’t always play out that way. 😕
content.text: So sorry, Tom. I am glad you had the opportunity to say goodbye though, it doesn’t always play out that way. 😕

content.html: Sorry to hear that. I feel you. Be strong and never forget.
content.text: Sorry to hear that. I feel you. Be strong and never forget.

content.html: Very likely that OSS contributions will be delayed/paused in near future. 😭
content.text: Very likely that OSS contributions will be delayed/paused in near future. 😭

content.html: Hey Tom, I'm so sorry to hear this. You're not alone. We lost our pup Bella to Cancer about a month ago over Christmas. She was with me for 15 years. They tried to save her but didn't make it out of surgery. Hit us harder than we could imagine.
content.text: Hey Tom, I'm so sorry to hear this. You're not alone. We lost our pup Bella to Cancer about a month ago over Christmas. She was with me for 15 years. They tried to save her but didn't make it out of surgery. Hit us harder than we could imagine.

content.html: Oh no, I'm so sorry, Tom!💔 Our cat is possible in a liver failure, we will know tomorrow 😭. She is 16, she is our first baby before we had the human ones.
content.text:
Oh no, I'm so sorry, Tom!💔
Our cat is possible in a liver failure, we will know tomorrow 😭. She is 16, she is our first baby before we had the human ones.

content.html: So sorry to hear this Tom, stay strong 💪 ❤️
content.text: So sorry to hear this Tom, stay strong 💪 ❤️

content.html: Sorry for your loss Tom! 😢
content.text: Sorry for your loss Tom! 😢

content.html: Oh my god... I'm so sorry to hear that... I'm lost for words of what to say... It's just hard to grasp...
content.text: Oh my god... I'm so sorry to hear that... I'm lost for words of what to say... It's just hard to grasp...

content.html: I am sad to hear that. Losing an animal is the same as losing a family member. Stay strong. I can say that I also feel your loss.
content.text: I am sad to hear that. Losing an animal is the same as losing a family member. Stay strong. I can say that I also feel your loss.

content.html: So sorry to hear that Tom. It sounds like Yoda had some of the best people he could've asked for ❤️
content.text: So sorry to hear that Tom. It sounds like Yoda had some of the best people he could've asked for ❤️

content.html: I get your point, but currently, email is something everyone is using, especially when you think worldwide.
content.text: I get your point, but currently, email is something everyone is using, especially when you think worldwide.

content.html: I'm not really sure about that. I'm not saying that Telegram is better! But email is also not really the best solution anymore. 🤔 At least I'm not using email for anything anymore.^^ And as I'm not checking them daily I also don't subscribe to any newsletters.
content.text:
I'm not really sure about that. I'm not saying that Telegram is better! But email is also not really the best solution anymore. 🤔
At least  I'm not using email for anything anymore.^^
And as I'm not checking them daily I also don't subscribe to any newsletters.

content.html: Thanks, definitely interesting but email is still most approachable for everyone so currently no solution for my problem. But still thanks and a good read.
content.text: Thanks, definitely interesting but email is still most approachable for everyone so currently no solution for my problem. But still thanks and a good read.

content.html: Yeah, switching to static method or depending on your framework primitive container binding would allow you to use CarbonInterval. For me it's always a check of interests and how hard it's really to read and how often do I have. A cache TTL of 5min isn't really useful as carbon.
content.text:
Yeah, switching to static method or depending on your framework primitive container binding would allow you to use CarbonInterval.
For me it's always a check of interests and how hard it's really to read and how often do I have.
A cache TTL of 5min isn't really useful as carbon.

content.html: Yeah, I usually clarify with a comment. A static method that returns CarbonInterval::totalSeconds could work similarly to your original suggestion. Perhaps I'll give that a try!
content.text: Yeah, I usually clarify with a comment. A static method that returns CarbonInterval::totalSeconds could work similarly to your original suggestion. Perhaps I'll give that a try!

content.html: But how would you solve this when using constants?
content.text: But how would you solve this when using constants?

content.html: There isn't a solution. If you HAVE TO use constants I would recommend the single integer or multiplication with a comment that clarifies the unit and in best case also what the number means "5 days in seconds" or similar.
content.text: There isn't a solution. If you HAVE TO use constants I would recommend the single integer or multiplication with a comment that clarifies the unit and in best case also what the number means "5 days in seconds" or similar.

content.html: Thanks, should be fairly easy done. If I can read the old number ;)
content.text: Thanks, should be fairly easy done. If I can read the old number ;)

content.html: No problem! 😊 Good luck migrating your code. 😉
